title: Predictive Maintenance of NYC Subways
description: I built a predictive maintenance framework composed of linear and tree-based models to predict passenger delays and subway disruptions by line. K-Means clustering helped identify the most vulnerable lines to the overall transit network. I presented my findings at 2025 NYC Open Data Week.

title: IntelliBART Database System
description: IntelliBART is a relational database management system that integrates BART ridership data with GTFS feeds, enabling seamless geospatial and temporal analysis of transit patterns across the Bay Area.

title: NYC Iconic Run Clubs
description: Inspired by Dan DeWitz's map of NY Time's 57 best sandwiches in NYC, I created a healthier homage: a map of run clubs in NYC.
tech_stack2: Python (Web Scrapping w/ BeautifulSoup), HTML, CSS

title: Transit Deserts in NYC
description: This map identifies dead transit zones by visualizing NYC subway system's network architecture, namely nodes, flows, and agents, using ArcGIS Pro and Network Analyst Toolkit.
tech_stack2: ArcGIS Pro (Network Analyst Toolkit), ArcGIS StoryMaps

title: MakAR AR Experience
description: MakAR is an Augmented Reality application for Meta Orion Smart Glasses, designed for use in the MakerLAB at Cornell Tech. It provides on-demand guidance for students and neophyte designers working with advanced equipment like laser cutters and 3D printers.

title: Designing Spatial Menus in AR
description: I reimagined the contextual menu interface proposed in Google's “Augmented Object Intelligence” paper by prototyping interaction improvements in ShapesXR. Working entirely in VR, I redesigned the menu to enhance discoverability and flow using iconography, dynamic opacity, and voice cues.

title: Forecasting Transit Ridership in the Bay Area
description: Inspired by Ben Wellington's I Quant NYC and Abhishek Roy's Commute Chronicles, I took a deep dive into Bay Area transit ridership trends. Using time-series forecasting, I assessed whether ridership would return to pre-pandemic levels.

title: Urban Tech Hub, NYC
description: The Urban Tech Hub at Cornell Tech is an academic think tank advancing human-centered technology for urban challenges. I work with professors to design and implement tech solutions for public and private partners, focusing on sustainability and urban innovation. Recent projects include developing tree-planting strategies for extreme heat mitigation and building a global resilience dashboard.

title: NYC AlgoMatcher
description: NYC AlgoMatcher is a website that helps New Yorkers understand which city algorithms might use their personal data to inform local decision-making, policymaking, and budgeting.

title: Tree Planting Strategies for Extreme Heat Mitigation
description: I developed sustainable tree-planting strategies in 5 NYC community districts using geospatial modeling, directly supporting decision-making by the NGO New Yorkers for Parks.

title: Disaster Tweet Classification using Natural Language Processing
description: I engineered an NLP model to classify tweets as disaster-related or not, achieving 89.2% accuracy on the test set. I built a preprocessing pipeline (stopword removal, lemmatization, and vectorization). Next, I applied feature extraction techniques like Bag of Words and N-Grams to train Logistic Regression and Bernoulli Naive Bayes models.

title: Cornell's TechTakes App
description: TechTakes is a mobile app for Cornell Tech students to rate, review, and discuss courses and professors. This fills a gap, as platforms like RateMyProfessors lack data for this newer institution. My partner and I developed storyboards and paper prototypes before creating a high-fidelity prototype in Figma. We tested the interface with students and iterated based on feedback to improve usability.

title: Trailmates Hiking App
description: Trailmates is a social app that helps users discover, plan, and share hikes through filters, social features, and a community feed. We prototyped a multimodal experience across mobile, desktop, and smartwatch interfaces.

title: Designing Interactions in VR
description: As part of a 3D interaction design project, I refined a VR architectural scene by implementing navigation, teleportation, snap turning interaction techniques. I used the XR Interaction Toolkit to prototype and test locomotion and feedback interactions on the Meta Quest 2.

title: How does disinformation spread?
description: I designed a bilingual survey experiment in English and Hindi as part of a PhD student’s research on misinformation and Bayesian belief updating. I crafted neutral questions to measure shifts in belief in response to news and social media clippings, and shared the survey in India to boost participation and capture diverse perspectives.

title: Tata Consultancy Services
description: I am developing AWS QuickSight app with ML analytics to drive real-time, data-driven decision-making for an Insurtech client

title: CSAA Insurance Group, an AAA Insurer
description: I was one of two product analysts overseeing Personal Lines Auto and Property Insurance in AZ, NV, and UT. For these states, I built the 3-year financial plan, improved geographic risk segmentation in the pricing algorithm, and delivered monthly performance updates to the senior leadership. I also supported the migration of data assets from SAS to the cloud-based Snowflake platform.
tech_stack2: SQL, Snowflake, Oracle Essbase, Microsoft Suite, Tableau

title: User-Centered Analysis of Transit Apps
description: I led a research project examining how student commuters use transit apps like MTA’s official app, Google Maps, and Apple Maps to navigate NYC public transportation. We designed and conducted semi-structured qualitative interviews, contextual inquiries, and surveys. Through qualitative coding and analysis, we identified key strengths and weaknesses in these apps’ journey planning and real-time update features.

title: CSAA Insurance Group, an AAA Insurer
description: I designed a business proposal for specialized Electric Vehicle insurance using Porter’s Five Forces, collaborating with actuaries and product specialists to assess market fit in California. I pitched it to senior leadership, earning recognition for its rigorous roadmap and cross-functional execution.

title: ESRI User Conference 2025
description: I helped run event logistics and got to learn about emerging GIS, AI, and LLM tools.

title: CSAA Insurance Group, an AAA Insurer
description: I formulated the company’s competitive positioning across six market profiles and 53 competitors in Maryland. I then identified a 5.5% sales growth opportunity by analyzing correlations between competitiveness and market share at the zip code level.

title: ESRI Developer & Technology Summit 2025
description: I helped run event logistics and got to learn about emerging GIS, AI, and LLM tools at one of the largest GIS conferences in the world.

title: Virtualization of the Public Sphere
description: A group of MS, Connective Media students and I investigated the fragmentation of the public sphere following the user exodus from Twitter/X to Bluesky after the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. We analyzed how platform design and moderation influence democratic discourse, drawing on philosophical frameworks to examine the shifting nature of shared digital spaces.

title: Project Manager @ Microfinance at Berkeley
description: I led a team of four to help two small businesses in Berkeley build e-commerce platforms by prototyping websites in Figma. I adapted project goals and team expectations in response to the pandemic, ensuring successful delivery and strong team morale.

title: Impact of Foreign Student Migration on US Innovation
description: I studied the history of U.S. student visa programs (F-1, OPT-STEM, H1-B) to identify intervention periods and control groups. I then conducted a Difference-in-Differences analysis to assess the impact of foreign student migration on U.S. patenting and authored a white paper.

title: Taxonomic Database System of Hawaiian Species
description: I co-digitized Elwood Zimmerman's seven multivolume series on Hawaiian insect taxonomy into a database in Microsoft Access. We organized taxonomical information and species interrelationships into a digitally accessible and searchable format.

title: Impacts of Quarantine Mandates on COVID-19 Cases in the US
description: Using OLS and weighted least squares (WLS) regressions on CDC data, I estimated the effects of strict quarantine mandates across six intervention windows and 3,143 U.S. counties. Model performance was evaluated with RMSE and visualized using choropleth maps. Results showed that stricter mandates reduced cases per capita by 3.3 percentage points within four months compared to more lenient policies.

title: Empirical Examination of Kuznets Environmental Model
description: I verified whether the Environmental Kuznets Curve holds using OLS regression on panel data from 161 countries in R. To ensure the validity of the estimators, I tested for homoskedasticity, autocorrelation, and endogeneity. I incorporated fixed effects and instrumental variables to address omitted variable and simultaneity bias. The analysis found empirical support for a parabolic relationship between economic growth and environmental degradation.

title: Gaussian Classifier for Handwritten Digit Recognition
description: I built a Gaussian classifier to recognize handwritten digits from the MNIST dataset using SciPy and Scikit-learn. I applied Linear Discriminant Analysis to reduce dimensionality and modeled class-conditional pixel probabilities with Gaussian distributions via maximum likelihood estimation. The classifier achieved 81.7% accuracy on the test set.

title: Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) Classifier for Image Classification
description: I developed a convolutional neural network to classify images from the CIFAR-10 dataset using PyTorch and TensorFlow. The three-layer CNN extracted hierarchical spatial features through a forward pass architecture. I fine-tuned the stride and activation functions, achieving 79.3% accuracy on the test set.

title: Version Control System for Local File Management
description: I built a version control system in Java to manage local repositories, track file history, and enable restoration. I used Java serialization to handle file objects and implemented linked list and tree structures to store and navigate activity history.

title: Recreating 2048 Game
description: I implemented the core game logic for a fully functional 2048 clone in Java, completing the tile merging, movement, and win/lose condition management within the grid. I ensured code quality by passing all automated tests and adhering to project style guidelines.

title: 2D Tile-Based World Exploration Game
description: I co-developed a 2D tile-based game in Java that allowed users to explore and interact with objects in pseudorandomly generated worlds. I designed classes, objects, and methods to define game entities and user behavior, applying object-oriented programming principles throughout. I also implemented a tile-based map system, a user interface, and a game loop to create a cohesive and engaging experience.
